title: Credit Score Risk Classification
description: Defines risk levels based on applicant credit score ranges

rules.notes: Excellent credit. Standard processing. No additional documentation required.
Good credit. Standard processing with routine verification.
Fair credit. Requires senior underwriter review. May require additional income verification.
Below average credit. Requires credit committee approval. Consider higher interest rate or larger down payment.
Poor credit. Application should be declined unless exceptional compensating factors exist.

title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Requirements
description: Establishes acceptable DTI thresholds for loan approval

rules.notes: Housing expense ratio within optimal range. Strong capacity for mortgage payments.
Total DTI within acceptable range. Standard approval pathway.
Elevated DTI. Requires compensating factors such as high credit score (>720), substantial reserves (6+ months), or stable employment history (5+ years).
High DTI. Requires exception approval from credit committee. Must document strong compensating factors.
DTI exceeds maximum threshold. Application should be declined.

calculation_method: Total Monthly Debt Payments / Gross Monthly Income * 100

title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Guidelines
description: Defines LTV thresholds and corresponding requirements

rules.notes: Standard LTV. No PMI required. Favorable terms available.
Elevated LTV. Private Mortgage Insurance (PMI) required. Minimum credit score of 680.
High LTV. PMI required. Minimum credit score of 720. Maximum DTI of 41%. Requires senior underwriter approval.
Very high LTV. Only available for first-time homebuyers. Credit score minimum 740. Requires credit committee approval.
LTV exceeds maximum allowable threshold. Consider FHA or VA loan programs if eligible.

title: Employment History Requirements
description: Evaluates employment stability as a credit risk factor

rules.notes: Strong employment stability. Positive factor for loan approval.
Adequate employment history. Standard verification required.
Limited employment history. Require previous employer verification. Consider industry stability.
Insufficient employment history or part-time status. Requires additional income documentation and credit committee review.
Self-employed applicants require 2 years of tax returns, profit/loss statements, and business verification.
No current employment. Application should be declined unless substantial passive income or assets exist.

regulatory_reference: Fannie Mae Selling Guide Section B3-3

title: Cash Reserve Requirements
description: Minimum reserve requirements based on loan type and risk factors

rules.notes: Strong reserves. Positive compensating factor. Can offset other risk factors.
Adequate reserves for standard conventional loans.
Minimum reserves. Acceptable for primary residence with strong credit profile.
Insufficient reserves. Requires compensating factors such as gift funds documentation or salary increase letter.

calculation_method: Liquid Assets / (Monthly Mortgage Payment + Monthly Debt Payments)
regulatory_reference: Fannie Mae Selling Guide Section B3-4
